name: MASDS ITP
Installation
Wiring installed in accordance with AS3000, SAPN, Telstra and Austel regulations
Fire penetrations to be sealed in accordance with manufacturers tested system to the locations as indicated on as built drawings complete with labels - Please attach photos
Acoustic penetrations to be sealed in accordance with approved sample wall & manufacturers tested system to the locations as indicated on as builts
Continuity and polarity checks carried out on all cables
MASDS Sampling Conduits, sampling points, MASDS detection unit and MASDS control modules installed in accordance with applicable drawings and I.E.I recommendations
Test Procedures

Final cleaning - check MASDS protection area to ensure it is dust free. Obtain confirmation from Builders site representative that no further works are to proceed within MASDS protected area after cleaning
Conducted MASDS testing procedures
Arrange formal SAMFs inspection and system testing
Sign-Off
Works completed to specification/drawings - Attach photos of work below
Request Builder Sign Off
Fire Water Tanks ITP
Installation
Tank roof and walls assembled in accordance with approved jsa's, shop drawings and approved construction drawings
Tank liner Installed in accordance with manufacturers data sheets and instructions
Ensure all tank panels, roof sheets, anchor bolts for tank internal braces are tight and no debris is left inside tank
Ensure all external tank connection fittings, access ladders, manhole covers, tank contents level indicators and external wind braces (if fitted) are correctly installed, tight and operational
Vacuum out any debris from inside tank and check all fixings/bolts for tightness. re-fit external manhole cover to form confined space
Tank leak test complete
Test Procedures
Make a detailed inspection of external walls of tank to check for any sign of a leak
Check ladders and manhole covers to ensure easy access is possible
Check tank contents gauge and signage for correct operation
Check tank roof and flashings to ensure no sharp edges and roof flashings are vermin proof
Sign-Off
Works completed to specification/drawings - Attach photos of work below
Sleeves ITP
Penetration sleeves installed in accordance with applicable, TFP/Combined approved drawings
Cast in pipework/sleeves as per approved engineer detail
Comment Notes relevant to inspection below
Fire Pumps ITP
Pumps & associated pipework installed in accordance with the approved drawings & AS2118. Pump room secure & lockable
Pump wiring installed in accordance with AS3000 & phase 3 & neutral power supply available
Fire water storage tank water supply available (suction) & all piping (discharge) & drains complete, pressure tested ready for use
Diesel engine filled with oil, fuel, batteries connected & diesel muffler & exhaust fitted to vent exhaust gases to atmosphere
Pump testing completed - detail any non-conformances below
Fire Alarms Second Fix
Installation

Detectors, bells, break glass alarms, automatic magnetic door holders, visual alarms, mimic panels, main FIP, data gathering panels all installed in accordance with applicable approved drawings and AS1668, AS2036, as1670,AS1603 and SAMFs requirements
Test Procedures
Ensure client and builders site representative are aware that fire alarm system is to be tested, resulting in audible alarms
Audible and visual alarms can be disconnected or isolated during test once they have been proved to be operational
Conducted SAMFs signalling device test procedures
Ensure all mechanical plant interface circuits are isolated or disconnected (smoke spill fans, gas solenoid, etc)
Arrange formal SAMFs inspection and system testing
Sign-Off
Works completed to specification/drawings - Attach photos of work below
Request Builder Sign Off
Fire Extinguishers ITP
Fire extinguishers & signs installed in accordance with AS 2444 & applicable approved drawing
Arranged SAMFS to carry out inspection and verify quantity and location of extinguishers are acceptable
Booster Installation ITP
Booster pipework cleaned & capped for transport to site
Booster pipework installed in accordance with applicable standards & specification utilising approved seismic fixings & bracing, approved fire penetration sealing
Boosters located in accordance with approved drawing & in accordance with AS2419
SAMFs approved hydrant values, hard suction & dual booster connectors fitted including pressure gauges
All above ground pipework securely fixed & plugged off & isolating valves closed & SAMFs required signage & block plans installed
Booster enclosure to be in accordance with SAMFs
Door hold open devices fitted & budget locks fitted as specified
Arrange for SAMFs to inspect fire booster assembly
Fire Alarms First Fix
Wiring installed in accordance with AS3000, ETSA regulations, Telstra and Austel regulations
Continuity and polarity checks carried out on all cables
Hose Reels ITP
Installation
Fire hose reels and signs installed in accordance with AS2441
Fire hose reels and sign installed in accordance with applicable approved drawing
Hose guides and rollers installed where applicable
Packing tapes removed, hose vented, water flow checked at minimum flow rate of 20 litres per minute
Fire hose reel turns freely with no excessive force
Test Procedures
Confirm hose reel pipework has been inspected and pressure tested as per ITP for hose reel pipework
With water supply valve to hose reels open, run out hose reels to full length and flow hose reels at full flow
Check hose reel assembly for leaks and secure fixings. Shut off water supply valve and rewind hoses
Arrange for SAMFs to carry out inspection and flow test on each hose reel
Arrange for client to witness SAMFs tests
Sign-Off
Works completed to specification/drawings - Attach photos of work below
Sprinkler System First Fix
Pipework installed in accordance with applicable TFP approved drawings
First fix sprinkler pipework, hangers, seismic fixings, guards, air bleed vents, drain valves fitted in accordance with AS2118
First Fix Pressure Test
Sprinkler System Second Fix
Installation
Second fix sprinkler pipework, hangers, seismic fixings, guards, air bleed vents, drain valves fitted in accordance with AS2118
Second Fix Pressure Test
Sprinkler seismic hanging systems to be installed to AS1170.4 & include engineers sign off & supporting documentation
Fire penetrations to be sealed in accordance with manufacturers tested system with the location indicated on as builts with labels - Please attach photos
Sprinkler head spacings & temperature ratings checked to comply with AS2118
Test Procedures
Connect air compressor to above ground pipework to be tested. Fill pipework with compressed air to 100kpa

Inspect above ground pipework for obvious leakage. Re-check pressure gauge and if no major pressure loss, pump up to 200kpa. Hold at 200kpa for 10 minutes. If no obvious air leakage from pipework being tested, release air pressure via control valve on compressor, and fill pipework with water to towns main pressure and set up TFP pressure test pump
Notify builders supervisor that fire services pipework is to be pressure tested
If no obvious loss of pressure pump switch on TFP pressure test pump and pump to 1600kpa and hold at this test pressure for at least two hours as specified
Sign-Off
Works completed to specification/drawings - Attach photos of work below
Hydrant Mains Risers ITP
Installation
Pipework installed in accordance with appliance standards, seismic fixings & specifications
Hydrant & hose reel pipework cleaned & capped for transport to site
Hydrant & hose reels located in accordance with AS2419
First fix hydrant pipework, hangers, seismic fixings, drain valves fitted in accordance with AS2419
Hydrant seismic hanging systems to be installed to AS1170.4 & include engineers sign off & supporting documentation
Hydrants installed in accordance with AS2419 and SA water requirements
Hydrant caps and chains fitted
Hydrant valve wheels or oval spindles fitted as specified
Hydrant hose connection checked for SAMFs approved thread
Inspection carried out by Engineer - Attached/Any relevant comments added below
Sign-off attached below as applicable
Fire penetrations to be sealed in accordance with manufacturers tested system to the locations as indicated on as built drawings complete with labels - Please attach photos
Inspection carried out by Engineer - Attached/Any relevant comments added below
Sign-off attached below as applicable
Acoustic penetrations to be sealed in accordance with approved sample wall & manufacturers tested system to the locations as indicated on as builts
Inspection carried out by Engineer - Attached/Any relevant comments added below
Sign-off attached below as applicable
Hose reels located in accordance with approved drawing and in accordance with AS2441
All above ground pipework securely fixed and plugged off and isolating valves closed
Inspection carried out - Detail any corrective action for non-conformance Inspections
Test Procedures
Review inspection details above to verify that all inspections are satisfactory and test procedures can now follows

Connect air compressor to above ground pipework to be tested. Fill pipework with compressed air to 100kpa. Inspect above ground pipework for obvious leakage. Re-check pressure gauge and if no major pressure loss, pump up to 200kpa
Hold at 200kpa for 10 minutes. If no obvious air leakage from pipework being tested, release air pressure via control valve on compressor, and fill pipework with water to towns main pressure
Connect pressure test pump to water filled section of pipework being tested. Pump to 1000kpa and hold pressure for 5 minutes
If no obvious loss of pressure, pump to 1500kpa. if no obvious loss of pressure pump to 1700kpa and hold at this test pressure for at least two hours
Sign-Off
Works completed to specification/drawings - Attach photos of work below
